Draft Legislation

A property and fiscal officer may intrust money to an officer of the National Guard to make disbursements as his agent. Both the officer to whom money is intrusted, and the property and disbursing officer intrusting the money to him, are pecuniarily responsible for that money to the United States. The agent officer is subject, for misconduct as an agent, to the liabilities and penalties prescribed by law in like cases for the property and fiscal officer for whom he is acting.

response: {"comp":"Both the agent officer and the property and fiscal officer remain financially responsible to the United States for the money."}
comp_correct: "Both the agent officer and the property and fiscal officer remain financially responsible to the United States for the money."

response: {"Q0":"This provision sounds very authoritative because it clearly assigns financial responsibility to both parties and specifies that misconduct will result in established legal penalties. The formal statutory language reinforces its seriousness and leaves little room for ambiguity."}

The Secretary may also contract for inspections or examinations in the United States and in foreign countries. The primary reason for including a provision that permits the contracting for the conduct of inspections and examinations is to provide flexibility in foreign areas where Coast Guard marine inspectors are not normally available. A contract inspector may be authorized to act on behalf of the Secretary, but may not issue a certificate of inspection or compliance.

response: {"comp":"They may act on behalf of the Secretary to conduct inspections or examinations, but may not issue a certificate of inspection or compliance."}

response: {"Q0":"This provision is very authoritative because it grants clear contracting authority to the Secretary, explains the purpose of the rule, and sets firm limits on contract inspectors’ powers. The formal language and explicit restriction on issuing certificates reinforce its seriousness and clarity."}

The seal provided under subsection (a)(3) may only be used on film or other approved copies of the Registry version of a film.

A subpoena under this subsection may be served anywhere in the United States. A witness subpoenaed under this subsection shall receive the same fees and expenses as a witness subpoenaed in connection with a civil proceeding in a court of the United States. Nothing in this subsection is intended to allow an alien to have access to classified information.

Draft Legislation

The Secretary may readjust the terms and conditions, except as otherwise provided herein, of any geothermal lease issued under this chapter at not less than ten-year intervals beginning ten years after the date the geothermal steam is produced, as determined by the Secretary. Each geothermal lease issued under this chapter shall provide for such readjustment. The Secretary shall give notice of any proposed readjustment of terms and conditions, and, unless the lessee files with the Secretary objection to the proposed terms or relinquishes the lease within thirty days after receipt of such notice, the lessee shall conclusively be deemed to have agreed with such terms and conditions.

response: {"comp":"When the lessee does not object to the proposed terms or relinquish the lease within thirty days after receiving notice."}
comp_correct: "When the lessee does not object to the proposed terms or relinquish the lease within thirty days after receiving notice."

response: {"Q0":"This provision is very authoritative because it grants the Secretary clear power to readjust geothermal lease terms at set intervals and and requires all leases to include this condition. It also enforces strict compliance by deeming lessees to have agreed if they fail to object or relinquish the lease within thirty days, leaving little room for discretion."}

The failure of a court to meet or comply with a time limitation under this section shall not be a ground for granting relief from a judgment of conviction or sentence. The State may enforce a time limitation under this section by petitioning for a writ of mandamus to the court of appeals. The court of appeals shall act on the petition for a writ of mandamus not later than 30 days after the filing of the petition.

response: {"comp":"The State may petition for a writ of mandamus to the court of appeals."}
comp_correct: "The State may petition for a writ of mandamus to the court of appeals."

response: {"Q0":"This provision is very authoritative because it removes the possibility of overturning convictions based on missed deadlines and establishes a strict enforcement mechanism through writs of mandamus. If at the termination of any fiscal year the legislature shall have failed to pass appropriation bills providing for payments of the necessary current expenses of the government and meeting its legal obligations for the ensuing fiscal year, then the several sums appropriated in the last appropriation bills for the objects and purposes therein specified, so far as the same may be applicable, shall be deemed to be reappropriated, item by item.

response: {"comp":"The amounts from the most recent appropriation bills are treated as reapproved for the same purposes."}
comp_correct: "The amounts from the most recent appropriation bills are treated as reapproved for the same purposes."

response: {"Q0":"This provision is very authoritative because it mandates automatic reappropriation of prior funding if the legislature fails to act, ensuring continuity of government operations. The binding language (“shall be deemed”) leaves no discretion, making the fallback mechanism enforceable and clear."}
